titleStmt.title: A form of thanksgiving to be used in all churches in and near about London immediately upon His Majesties return, and to be continued till the day of publick thanksgiving. By Her Majesties special command.
titleStmt.author: Church of England.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by Charles Bill and the executrix of Thomas Newcomb, deceas'd; printers to the King and Queens most Excellent Majesties,

notesStmt.note: Order to print (on verso of title page) dated: October 17. 1691.

Caption title on p. 1 reads: Instead of the Prayer for the King, while His Majesty was abroad in the wars, this following thanksgiving shall be used in all churches in and near about London, immediately upon His Majesties return, and be continued till the day of publick thanksgiving, which will shortly be appointed.
Identified as Wing (2nd ed., 1994) C4180 on UMI microfilm "Early English books, 1641-1700" reel 1985.
Reproduction of the original in the Christ Church Library, Oxford.

person.persName: Charles Bill and the executrix of Thomas Newcomb, deceas'd;
